guide: Hi, ${guide} here. I'm glad to see you downloaded the app!
You may be going through a difficult time right now.
My hope is that what's here in the app can help.

slides.text: Find your favorite videos and supportive contacts on the home page.
Hear stories from people with lived experience on the Shared Stories section.
I want to make it easier to use your stability plan. You can see your plan here.
We can walk through it step by step here in the 'Distress Survival Guide.'
Plus, some additional videos and skills for getting through difficult times.
I've put some together some contacts so they're all in one place for you.
I've also included some information about how to get the help you need from supportive people.

guide: The app has a lot that can help in a crisis. But it's not a substitute for professional help from a doctor or therapist.
I really want you get the right help in the hardest times.
If you are in a medical emergency or contemplating acting on thoughts of suicide, call 911 or the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (1-800-273-8255) immediately.
I'm really glad you took the step to use this app and have access to these resources.
